The Story: The DAX 40 right now is a pure macro playground. Germany is still the heavyweight of Europe, but it is carrying some serious baggage: weak manufacturing, energy cost hangovers and a central bank that is trying to look tough while the real economy quietly begs for mercy.
The European Central Bank (ECB) and its rate path are the main puppet masters here. As long as traders believe the ECB is close to peak rates or even preparing for a cautious pivot, equity markets – and especially the export-heavy DAX – can breathe. If the tone shifts back to aggressive anti-inflation talk, the air comes out of the balloon fast.
Christine Lagarde and the Euro – why DAX traders care more than ever
Every time ECB President Christine Lagarde steps to the mic, DAX traders perk up. Her messaging around inflation, growth risks and future rate decisions directly feeds into three crucial DAX drivers:
- Discount rate for earnings: Higher rates mean lower present value for future earnings. That hits growth and tech names hard, and weighs on the entire index multiple.
- Euro vs. US Dollar (EUR/USD): A stronger Euro can hurt German exporters by making their products more expensive globally. A weaker Euro, on the other hand, often acts like a tailwind for DAX companies with big overseas revenues.
- Risk appetite in Europe: If the ECB looks more supportive and less combative, global funds are more willing to rotate into Europe from US mega caps. Hawkish surprises do the exact opposite.
Right now, markets are stuck in a tug-of-war between sticky inflation data and visibly slowing growth. That creates a nervous, headline-driven DAX where one speech from Lagarde or one surprise inflation print can flip intraday direction completely.
EUR/USD as the stealth DAX indicator
Watch the Euro. When EUR/USD drifts weaker, it often signals:
- Lower confidence in European growth
- But potentially better conditions for German exporters in dollar terms
That weird combo means you can sometimes see soft macro headlines in Germany but a surprisingly resilient DAX because big exporters and global champions get a currency tailwind. When EUR/USD rips higher, the story can invert: the macro narrative looks prettier, but export margins get squeezed, and the DAX can lag behind US indices.
ECB + EUR/USD + DAX = Trade Setup
Put simply:
- Dovish ECB tone + slightly weaker Euro = environment where DAX bulls love to hit the buy-the-dip button.
- Hawkish ECB shock + stronger Euro = classic trap zone where late bulls can get slammed by profit-taking and sharp pullbacks.
If you are trading the DAX without watching ECB meetings, Lagarde speeches and the Euro chart, you are basically playing blindfolded.

source_articles.title: Earnings Update: Here's Why Analysts Just Lifted Their Align Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:ALGN) Price Target To US$195 - Yahoo Finance
source_articles.body:
Earnings Update: Here's Why Analysts Just Lifted Their Align Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:ALGN) Price Target To US$195
Shareholders of Align Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:ALGN) will be pleased this week, given that the stock price is up 15% to US$188 following its latest full-year results. Align Technology reported in line with analyst predictions, delivering revenues of US$4.0b and statutory earnings per share of US$5.65, suggesting the business is executing well and in line with its plan. This is an important time for investors, as they can track a company's performance in its report, look at what experts are forecasting for next year, and see if there has been any change to expectations for the business. So we collected the latest post-earnings statutory consensus estimates to see what could be in store for next year.
After the latest results, the 15 analysts covering Align Technology are now predicting revenues of US$4.19b in 2026. If met, this would reflect a satisfactory 3.7% improvement in revenue compared to the last 12 months. Per-share earnings are expected to soar 40% to US$8.02. Before this earnings report, the analysts had been forecasting revenues of US$4.17b and earnings per share (EPS) of US$7.92 in 2026. So it's pretty clear that, although the analysts have updated their estimates, there's been no major change in expectations for the business following the latest results.
Check out our latest analysis for Align Technology
The consensus price target rose 6.2% to US$195despite there being no meaningful change to earnings estimates. It could be that the analystsare reflecting the predictability of Align Technology's earnings by assigning a price premium. There's another way to think about price targets though, and that's to look at the range of price targets put forward by analysts, because a wide range of estimates could suggest a diverse view on possible outcomes for the business. The most optimistic Align Technology analyst has a price target of US$225 per share, while the most pessimistic values it at US$150. This shows there is still a bit of diversity in estimates, but analysts don't appear to be totally split on the stock as though it might be a success or failure situation.
One way to get more context on these forecasts is to look at how they compare to both past performance, and how other companies in the same industry are performing. We can infer from the latest estimates that forecasts expect a continuation of Align Technology'shistorical trends, as the 3.7% annualised revenue growth to the end of 2026 is roughly in line with the 4.4% annual growth over the past five years. By contrast, our data suggests that other companies (with analyst coverage) in a similar industry are forecast to see their revenues grow 7.8% per year. So although Align Technology is expected to maintain its revenue growth rate, it's forecast to grow slower than the wider industry.

Since the stock has added US$54m to its market cap in the past week alone, let's see if underlying performance has been driving long-term returns.
There is no denying that markets are sometimes efficient, but prices do not always reflect underlying business performance. One flawed but reasonable way to assess how sentiment around a company has changed is to compare the earnings per share (EPS) with the share price.
TriMas was able to grow EPS by 67% in the last twelve months. It's fair to say that the share price gain of 52% did not keep pace with the EPS growth. So it seems like the market has cooled on TriMas, despite the growth. Interesting.

A Different Perspective

source_articles.title: S Korean crypto firm accidentally pays out $40bn in bitcoin - BBC
source_articles.body:
S Korean crypto firm accidentally pays out $40bn in bitcoin
A South Korean cryptocurrency exchange accidentally gave away more than $40bn (£32bn) worth of bitcoin to customers, briefly making them multi-millionaires.
It had planned to give customers a small cash reward of 2,000 won - $1,37 - but instead gave them 2,000 bitcoins on Friday.
The platform, Bithumb, apologised for the error, adding that it quickly had realised its mistake and recovered almost all the missing tokens.
It said it had restricted trading and withdrawals for the 695 affected customers within 35 minutes of the glitch.
The company said it had recovered 99.7% of the 620,000 bitcoins mistakenly sent.
"We want to make it clear that this matter has nothing to do with external hacking or security breaches, and there is no problem with system security or customer asset management," Bithumb said in a statement on Friday.
In an emergency meeting on Saturday, South Korea's financial regulator said it would look into the incident. Any sign of illegal activity would prompt formal investigations, the Financial Supervisory Service (FSS).
Bithumb vowed to co-operate with regulators. "[We] will take this accident as a lesson and prioritise 'customer trust and peace of mind' rather than external growth," CEO Lee Jae-won said.
The company plans to pay 20,000 won ($13,66) in compensation to all customers who were using the platform at the time, and will waive trading fees, among other measures.
Bithumb said it would improve verification systems and introduce AI to detect abnormal transactions.
The incident is likely to spark discussion around tighter regulatory controls in finance.
In April 2024 Citigroup, a US bank, mistakenly credited $81 trillion, instead of $280, to a customer's account. Two employees failed to spot the error before it was processed, but the bank reversed the transaction within hours after a third employee caught the mistake, the Financial Times reported.

source_articles.title: Green Day’s Billie Joe Armstrong Implores ICE Agents to ‘Quit Your S—ty Jobs’ at Super Bowl Party, Says Trump ‘Will Drop You Like a Bad Habit… Come on This Side of the Line’ - Variety
source_articles.body:
Two days prior to taking part in the Super Bowl‘s opening ceremony, Green Day‘s Billie Joe Armstrong made it clear that football fervor has not tamped down his conscience about current events. During a performance by the band at a Spotify-sponsored Super Bowl party Friday night, he implored ICE agents to resign, saying that they would be thrown under the bus by the Trump administration eventually anyway.
“To all the ICE agents out there, wherever you are,” said Armstrong from the stage, “quit your shitty-ass job. Quit that shitty job you have. Because when this is over — and it will be over at some point in time — Kristi Noem, Stephen Miller, JD Vance, Donald Trump, they’re gonna drop you like a bad fucking habit. Come on this side of the line.”
Armstrong also changed some of the band’s lyrics to reference topical issues. Singing “Holiday,” he changed the words from “the representative from California has the floor” to “the representative from Epstein Island has the floor.” He offered a dedication prior to that same song, saying, “This goes out to Minneapolis.” Additionally, as he has for years now, Armstrong sang “I’m not part of the MAGA agenda” instead of “…part of a redneck agenda” in “American Idiot.”
Popular on Variety
Video clips of Armstrong’s statements were widely shared from the party, a special invitation-only concert on San Francisco’s Pier 29 on the Embarcadero that was sponsored by FanDuel and Spotify.
Green Day is set to perform in the pre-game ceremony at Super Bowl LX, when the group will “usher generations of Super Bowl MVPs onto the field.” An exact time for Green Day’s performance has not been given, but the game itself starts at 6:30 p.m. ET/3:30 PT, with pre-game music likely to be seen in the hour before start time. The full day of pre-game coverage begins at noon ET on NBC.
The Seattle Seahawks will face off against the New England Patriots. Other musical performances set to immediately precede the game include Charlie Puth singing “The Star-Spangled Banner,” Brandi Carlile performing “America the Beautiful” and Coco Jones delivering “Lift Every Voice and Sing.”
Bad Bunny will perform at the halftime show, with that booking being controversial in some right-leaning pockets of America. An alternative halftime show, due to be telecast from an undisclosed location, is being promoted by the conservative organization Turning Point USA, with Kid Rock headlining and country artists Brantley Gilbert, Gabby Barrett and Lee Brice also performing.
Green Day was picked to perform at the Super Bowl in part because of their long association with the Bay area, where this year’s game is taking place, as well as the group’s enduring popularity as a stadium-level act after 35 years of releasing music.

source_articles.title: The 2026 Mazda 3 2.5 S Premium Hatchback Has a Special Secret - Car and Driver
source_articles.body:
As a long-standing member of the tribe known as Save the Manuals!—some would say long-standing enough to be its elder statesman—I'm always chuffed to learn of a car that offers a gearbox requiring you to stir your own cogs. There's something about coordinating the actions of your right arm and left leg with those of your throttle foot, all in the pursuit of smooth forward progress, that engages the mind and ratchets up involvement in the act of driving in a way that triggers small, steady doses of happiness.
That's likely why the part of my brain that anticipates pleasurable experiences clicked on when I pulled open the door of the Mazda 3 2.5 S Hatchback Premium and spied a stubby manual shifter sprouting from the center console. Eureka! We already like the funky little hatchback for its aggro looks and pleasant demeanor, but this is the one model in the 3 lineup that offers something our favorite hot hatch, the current 10Best-winning Volkswagen GTI, does not: a manual gearbox.
For Sale Near You
See all results for new 2026 Mazda Mazda 3 for sale near 50317
Could the do-it-yourself six-speed transmission be the piquant arrabbiata sauce that transforms the pleasant Mazda 3 recipe into something mouthwatering—a viable alternative to the spunky Vee-Dub? Time for a taste.
While I admit that the presence of a DIY gearbox elicits a subtle Pavlovian response deep in my gut, it does nothing to guarantee that the driving experience is going to be out of the ordinary. Any gearbox, no matter how rewarding its shift action, has to work harmoniously with the engine, clutch, and throttle. The rest of the car that it lives in counts too: A slick gearbox can't make a bad car good, but a bad car can make a great manual transmission irrelevant.
No worries about any of that with the Mazda 3 2.5 S Premium Hatchback. Almost everything about it feels, well, premium, more like what you'd expect if it were wearing a BMW, Genesis, or Mercedes badge.
The feel-good starts the moment you slip inside. From the driver's seat, you survey an interior covered in soft materials: faux black leather on the dash and doors, with chocolate-brown inserts in the black leather seats. French seams in contrasting color abound—on the doors, dash, center console, and center armrest. Harder materials are largely kept below eye level. Touches of metal trim brighten the cabin. The instrument cluster is home to round tach and speedo gauges in traditional white-on-black.
The overall effect is tastefully restrained and unexpectedly rich; photos have a hard time doing it justice. There are plenty of standard features inside as well, including a Bose 12-speaker stereo, power driver's seat with power lumbar and memory, heated front seats, leather-covered steering wheel, and a moonroof. (Our test car was jazzed up with the show-car-like Soul Red Crystal Metallic paint for $595, silly illuminated door-sill plates for $575, and $190 worth of all-weather floor mats.)
The premium vibe continues when you fire up and drive off. The naturally aspirated 2.5-liter inline-four emits a quiet, buttered-rum hum that sounds expensive. And the central focus of this model, the six-speed manual gearbox, is a sweet complement to the 3's four-cylinder. Clutch action is effortless and easy to modulate for smooth getaways and shifts. The shifter slides through the gears much like those on BMWs of the recent past; it's well isolated from vibration, and each throw lands softly at the end of the lever's travel. It feels like money.
Of course, with just 186 horsepower, the Mazda can't match the 241-hp VW's performance. The GTI lost its manual as of the 2025 model year, and with its standard dual-clutch automatic, the current GTI charges to 60 mph in just 5.6 seconds; for the record, our 2022 long-term GTI with the six-speed manual did the deed in 5.8. The stick-shift 3 takes 7.0 seconds to get to the mile-a-minute mark. The gap widens further in the quarter-mile, with the current GTI zipping through in 14

source_articles.title: Cyberdyne Aktie: Warten auf Wahlsignale - Börse Global
source_articles.body:
Cyberdyne Aktie: Warten auf Wahlsignale
Die Cyberdyne-Aktie steht vor einem entscheidenden Wochenstart, geprägt von der japanischen Parlamentswahl und einer abwartenden Stimmung im Robotik-Sektor trotz positiver Langfristprognosen.
- Abwartende Haltung im Robotik-Sektor trotz steigendem Nikkei
- Wachstumsprognose für Pflegerobotik bis 2033
- Japan-Wahl als kurzfristiger Schlüsselfaktor
- Yen-Entwicklung beeinflusst exportorientierte Tech-Werte
Anleger blicken an diesem Wochenende gespannt nach Japan, während unternehmensspezifische Nachrichten ausbleiben. Das Marktumfeld für Technologieaktien bleibt jedoch hochdynamisch: Die morgige Parlamentswahl und neue Branchendaten könnten die Richtung für die kommende Woche vorgeben.
- Uneinheitliche Signale: Der Nikkei 225 stieg am Freitag um 0,81 %, während der Robotik-Sektor leicht nachgab.
- Wachstumstrend: Analysten prognostizieren dem Pflegerobotik-Markt deutliche Zuwächse bis 2033.
- Politisches Event: Die japanische Parlamentswahl am Sonntag rückt als zentraler Einflussfaktor in den Fokus.
Robotik-Sektor hinkt Marktrally hinterher
Die Handelswoche endete für den japanischen Aktienmarkt mit gegensätzlichen Impulsen. Während der Leitindex Nikkei 225 am Freitag mit einem Plus von 0,81 % auf 54.253,68 Punkten schloss, konnte der spezialisierte Robotik-Sektor diesen Aufwind nicht nutzen. Der Global X Japan Robotics & AI ETF beendete den Handel mit einem leichten Minus von 0,21 %.
Sollten Anleger sofort verkaufen? Oder lohnt sich doch der Einstieg bei Cyberdyne?
Diese Entkoppelung verdeutlicht, dass Investoren im Bereich der Automatisierung derzeit eine abwartende Haltung einnehmen. Für Cyberdyne liefert dieses zögerliche Sektorumfeld den entscheidenden Kontext für den Start in die neue Woche.
Positive Prognosen für Pflegeroboter
Trotz fehlender aktueller Finanzdaten von Cyberdyne entwickelt sich das fundamentale Marktumfeld für das Kerngeschäft weiter. Ein neuer Marktbericht zur Pflegerobotik prognostiziert der Branche bis 2033 ein erhebliches Wachstum. Die steigende Nachfrage nach technologischen Lösungen in der häuslichen Pflege und Rehabilitation stützt die langfristige Relevanz von Exoskelett-Systemen.
Auch der Wettbewerb bleibt aktiv. Bereits zu Beginn des Jahres unterstrich die Präsentation neuer Exoskelette auf der CES 2026 das globale Interesse an physischer KI. Kann die politische Neuausrichtung in Japan nun den nötigen Impuls für eine Neubewertung der Branche liefern?
Entscheidung am Wahltag
Der unmittelbare Fokus liegt nun auf der politischen Bühne. Am morgigen Sonntag finden in Japan Parlamentswahlen statt. Politische Stabilität und mögliche Weichenstellungen in der Gesundheits- und Wirtschaftsförderung gelten traditionell als Kurstreiber für den Standort Tokio.
Zusätzlich beobachten Marktteilnehmer die Entwicklung des Yen. Da exportorientierte Technologieunternehmen empfindlich auf Währungsschwankungen reagieren, wird die Reaktion der Währung auf das Wahlergebnis am Montagmorgen entscheidend sein.
Am Sonntagabend werden die ersten Ergebnisse der japanischen Parlamentswahl vorliegen. Für Cyberdyne-Anleger entscheidet am Montag vor allem die Reaktion des Yen und die allgemeine Stimmungslage im Nikkei 225 über den kurzfristigen Trend.
